title: Nine surprising celebrity arrests - including Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Grant

Over the weekend, Supernatural and Gilmore Girls star Jared Padalecki, 37, was arrested for allegedly assaulting two people outside a bar in Austin, Texas.

The news about the dad-of-three shocked his fans and proved a big talking point on Twitter , with many people discussing how celebrities are human and sometimes they make "poor decisions", just like the rest of us.

In light of this, here's a look at some other celebrities who have been arrested over the years - including Cher, Bruno Mars and Matthew McConaughey.

(Image: Getty)

(Image: Getty)

Reese Witherspoon

The Legally Blonde star had a run-in with the law back in 2013.

The Oscar-winner was arrested in Atlanta for disorderly conduct after her husband Jim Toth was pulled over by traffic police.

As Toth was breathalysed, Witherspoon is said to have refused to get back into the car and told police: "Do you know my name. You’re about to find out who I am. You're about to be on national news."

The actress apologised for her behaviour in a statement after being released on bail.

She said: "I clearly had one drink too many and I am deeply embarrassed about the things I said.

"It was definitely a scary situation and I was frightened for my husband, but that is no excuse."

(Image: Getty Images)

Hugh Grant

In 1995, hot off the back of Four Weddings and a Funeral, everyone's favourite rom-com star was arrested in Los Angeles alongside sex worker Divine Brown (real name Estella Marie Thompson) for "lewd conduct".

It is believed the actor was caught receiving oral sex in his car, after meeting Divine on the notorious Sunset Strip.

The 59-year-old, who was dating actress Liz Hurley at the time, has described the incident as a moment of "insanity".

In a statement he said: "Last night I did something completely insane.

"I have hurt people I love and embarrassed people I work with. For both things I am more sorry than I can ever possibly say."

(Image: Netflix)

Winona Ryder

Ryder, who is known for roles in Stranger Things and Heathers, was arrested in December 2001 for shoplifting.

The actress was accused of stealing over $5,000 worth of designer clothing and accessories from Saks, Fifth Avenue.

The 48-year-old was convicted of grand theft, shoplifting and vandalism but was acquitted on the charge of burglary.

As a result, she was sentenced to three years probation, 480 hours of community service, $3,700 worth of fines plus ordered to pay $6,355 back to the Saks store and attend counselling.

(Image: GC)

Stephen Fry

As a teen, back before he became a household name, Fry was arrested and spent three months in prison for credit card fraud.

He is said to have taken a coat from a family friend when leaving a pub and later found the card in the pocket.

He went on a spending spree and was picked up by police in Swindon.

Upon his release, he returned to Norfolk, where he had grown up, to complete his A Levels at City College Norwich.

(Image: Splash News)

Nina Dobrev

In 2009, ahead of the premiere of her hit show, The Vampire Diaries, Dobrev was arrested alongside three of her co-stars, Candice King, Kayla Ewell and Sara Canning.

The four women got into a spot of trouble in Georgia after the sheriff's department caught them having a risky photoshoot on a bridge, distracting drivers.

They were charged with disorderly conduct and released after paying a fine.

(Image: ETIENNE LAURENT/EPA-EFE/REX)

Keanu Reeves

The star of The Matrix and The Lake House was pulled over and arrested in 1993 for drink driving.

He avoided a harsh sentence by admitting to driving under the influence and reckless driving and was later released.

Cher

At the age of just 13, Cher was arrested after she "borrowed" a friend's car to go to a drive-in movie theatre.

The teen had been asked to watch her friend's car while he went off to do something, but got tired of waiting.

Her mother, Georgia Holt, shared a photo of Cher's mug shot on The Tonight Show in 2013 and said: "[The police] called me at 3:30 in the morning and said we have your daughter down here at the station."

(Image: WireImage)

Bruno Mars

The Just The Way You Are singer was arrested in Las Vegas in 2010 for possession of cocaine.

Speaking about the incident, he said: "I was young, man! I was in f***ing Vegas. I wasn't thinking."

The felony charges against him were later dropped.

(Image: AFP)

Matthew McConaughey

Hollywood star Matthew McConaughey was arrested in 1999 on suspicion of possession of marijuana, possession of drug paraphernalia and resisting transportation.

His neighbours called the police to make a noise complaint at 3am and when officers arrived at his house in Texas, they found him naked as the day he was born and playing bongo drums.

He was ultimately charged only with resisting transportation.

Speaking in 2016, the Dallas Buyers Club actor, who was just 29 at the time of arrest, joked about the incident.

"What's wrong with beating on your drums in your birthday suit?" he quipped. "I have no regrets about the way I got there."
description: A number of famous faces have been arrested over the last few years
